CORSMiddleware ( * , allow_methods : Optional[AbstractSet[str]] , allow_headers : Optional[AbstractSet[str]] , allow_credentials : bool , allow_origin_regex : Optional[str] , expose_headers : AbstractSet[str] , max_age : int ) Parameters ¶ * (optional) allow_methods : Optional[AbstractSet[str]] An optional set of allowed methods, or None for all methods. Defaults to None. allow_headers : Optional[AbstractSet[str]] An optional set of allowed headers, or None for all headers. Defaults to None. allow_credentials : bool If True allow credentials, otherwise disallow. Defaults to False. allow_origin_regex : Optional[str] An optional regex pattern to apply to origins. Defaults to None. expose_headers : AbstractSet[str] An optional set of headers to expose. Defaults to None. max_age : int The maximum age in seconds. Defaults to 600.

docs.text: Installation ¶ The package can be installed with pip. pip install bareasgi-cors This is a Python3.7 and later package with dependencies on: bareASGI

docs.text: Usage ¶ The support is implemented as middleware. from bareasgi import Application from bareasgi_cors import CORSMiddleware cors_middleware = CORSMiddleware () app = Application ( middlewares = [ cors_middleware ]) Post Routes ¶ Before issuing a POST across origin an OPTION request will be made. This means that every post route must also support OPTION. Here is an example: app . http_router . add ({ 'POST' , 'OPTIONS' }, '/info' , set_info )
